page.title: 16LARTINGTON HALL
page.content: donations to local charaties and organisations involved in country pursuits. The history of Lartington Hall is very interesting. For over 1000 years there has been a settlement near the sight of the present Hall. It first appears in the Doomsday Book as 'Lertington' where there were 'three caricatures of land with two ploughs'. The original hamlet was believed to be in Crow's Wood to the south of the Hall. Robert de Lascelles lived here in 1208 having the land from the Fitchugags of Ravensworth. During the riegn of Elizabeth I it became the royal patronage and the Countess of Devon, of Shrewsbury and the Duchess of Devonshire wrer involved in selling the Lartington Manor. Information about the owners of the hall since the can be found under the keyword
